intro: Myosotis cynoglossoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in damp, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous small, delicate flowers throughout the spring and summer. Myosotis cynoglossoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
